newsitem.title: CZECH REPUBLIC: PRESS DIGEST - Czech Republic - April 7.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Czech Republic - April 7.

text.p: HOSPODARSKE NOVINY - Investicni a Postovni Banka (IPB) had net profits of 857 million crowns last year, according to Ernst & Young. This is 650 million crowns less than the total the Prague Stock Exchange presented as official preliminary results a few days ago.

- According to the most recent announcement from Health Minister Jan Strasky, health insurance companies owe 2.7 billion crowns to health institutions after the deadline for payment. Strasky's original estimate was four billion crowns.
- Tatra Koprivnice established its first foreign joint venture for manufacturing heavy freight vehicles in India by signing a contract on Friday in Plzen with the Indian company Venus.

PRAVO - The union of Czech doctors stated on Saturday that they consider Health Minister Jan Strasky incompetent as head of the Health Ministry and that the Civic Democratic Party (ODS) is entirely responsible for the crisis in health services.

- The new proposal for railway transport, which Transport Minister Martin Riman will present to economic ministers, would discontinue 34 percent of the 9,456 kilometres of track used by Czech Railways.
- RWE Energie, a leading energy company in Germany, which recently obtained 10.33 percent of Stredoceska Energetika, bought a 11.7 percent stake in Prazska Energetika.
MLADA FRONTA DNES - The Health Ministry decided to begin measures for payment of health insurance companies' debts in about two weeks.
- If large retail companies succeed in their ambitious plans, new shops will begin appearing around large cities at a faster rate than the Czech Republic is used to.

- The American computer company Unisys, which came second in the tender to build a staff information system for the Czech Army, is attempting to change the decision of Defence Minister Miloslav Vyborny. Unisys claims that the winner of the tender, EDS-Digital, did not include 1,290 army computers in its original price.

LIDOVE NOVINY - On Saturday, Roman Ceska, chairman of the National Property Fund, and the chairman of the parliamentary committee for culture, Michal Prokop, became the new vice-chairmen of the Civic Democratic Alliance (ODA).
- Dentists are not satisfied with the new law on public health insurance and request that the cabinet, parliament and Senate resolve the critical legislative situation with health services.

- The National Property Fund announced an initial price of 35 million crowns for the public tender for the sale of 100 percent of shares of Eska Cheb a.s., one of the three largest domestic manufacturers of bicycles.
